item.title: Investigating an Ontology-Informed Approach to Event Log Generation in Healthcare
item.description: ğŸ‘¥ Owen P. Dwyer, Lara Chammas, Emanuel Sallinger, Jim Davies ğŸ“• 6th International Workshop on Process-Oriented Data Science for Healthcare @ ICPM 2023 ğŸ“„ Full paper - available soon ğŸ… Best Student Paper Process mining methods have the potential to reveal useful patterns in hospital data and provide insights into patterns of treatment, but healthcare has proven an exceptionally challenging domain due to the significant heterogeneity of possible events and the diversity of individual patients.

item.title: Reasoning over Health Records with Vadalog: a Rule-based Approach to Patient Pathways
item.description: ğŸ‘¥ Owen P. Dwyer, Teodoro Baldazzi, Jim Davies, Emanuel Sallinger and Adriano Vlad ğŸ“• 7th International Rule Challenge @ RuleML+RR 2023 ğŸ“„ Full paper ğŸ… Best Rule Challenge Paper In recent years, the scale of biomedical and healthcare data has grown exponentially, leading to companies building large enterprise knowledge graphs as well as scalable and intelligent processing systems to exploit them. In this high-stakes domain, the transparency of data-driven processes is paramount to ensure high levels of trustworthiness and accountability for patient safety.

item.title: Profiling IoT-based Botnet Traffic using DNS
item.description: ğŸ‘¥ Owen P. Dwyer, Angelos K. Marnerides, Vasileios Giotsas, Troy Mursch ğŸ“• GLOBECOM 2019 ğŸ“„ Full paper Internet-wide security and resilience have traditionally been subject to large-scale DDoS attacks initiated by various types of botnets. Since the Mirai outbreak in 2016 myriads of Mirai-alike IoT-based botnets have emerged. Such botnets rely on Miraiâ€™s base malware code and they infiltrate vulnerable IoT devices on an Internet-wide scale such as to instrument them to perform large-scale attacks such as DDoS.
